001package Calibration_Plugins_2;
002
003import ij.IJ;
004import ij.ImagePlus;
005import ij.ImageStack;
006import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
007import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
008import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.data.CalibrationImage;
009import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.data.ZhangData;
010import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.Camera;
011import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.RectificationMapping;
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
013import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
014import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
015import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
016
017/**
018 * This plugin opens an image stack containing the 5 Zhang test images and removes the lens distortion based on the
019 * intrinsic camera parameters estimated by calibration. The resulting (rectified) frames are shown in a new image
020 * stack. Note that this plugin uses pre-calculated camera parameters, i.e., no calibration is performed.
021 *
022 * @author W. Burger
023 * @version 2022/12/19
024 */
025public class Rectify_Camera_Demo implements PlugIn {
026
027        private static ImageResource resource = CalibrationImage.CalibImageStack;
028
029        public void run(String arg0) {
030                // open the test image (stack):
031                ImagePlus testIm = resource.getImagePlus();
032
033                if (testIm == null) {
034                        IJ.error("Could not open calibration images!");
035                        return;
036                }
037                testIm.show();
038                String title = testIm.getShortTitle();
039
040                // get pre-calculated camera intrinsics (typically by calibration):
041                Camera camera = ZhangData.getCameraIntrinsics();
042
043                // create a special geometric mapping
044                Mapping2D mapping = new RectificationMapping(camera);   // inverse, ie., maps target to source
045
046                // get the original (distorted) image stack:
047                ImageStack distStack = testIm.getStack();
048                final int w = distStack.getWidth();
049                final int h = distStack.getHeight();
050                final int M = distStack.getSize();
051
052                // create a new stack for the rectified images:
053                ImageStack rectStack = new ImageStack(w, h);
054                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
055                        ImageProcessor source = distStack.getProcessor(i + 1);
056                        ImageProcessor target = source.createProcessor(w, h);
057                        ImageMapper mapper = new ImageMapper(mapping, null, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic);
058                        mapper.map(source, target);
059                        String label = distStack.getSliceLabel(i + 1);
060                        rectStack.addSlice(label, target);
061                }
062                // display the new stack:
063                new ImagePlus(title + " (rectified)", rectStack).show();
064        }
065
066}
